Html:
Hello.

Without modifying CSK 2.0, i noticed that non-administrators cannot add a new event. Is that the way it is supposed to be.

I noticed that the event link opens the Events\Calendar.aspx, so i attempted to open that page in designer mode using VS2005 Pro. When i did that, i got this error message:
---------------------------
Microsoft Visual Studio
---------------------------
Can not switch to Design view because of errors in the page. Please correct all errors labeled 'Can not switch:' in the Error List and try again.
---------------------------
OK
---------------------------

After i click OK, there are twelve errors in the error list. The first one is this:
"Error 1 Element 'ScriptManager' is not a known element. This can occur if there is a compilation error in the Web site. "

I don't understand how i can build the site without errors, yet opening that page causes those twelve errors.

Any help would be gratefully appreciated.

Thanks,
Tony

Yea, that is the way it is supposed to be.

That error is caused by ASP.NET AJAX. Do you have that installed on your system?

z2bass wrote:
Yea, that is the way it is supposed to be.

That error is caused by ASP.NET AJAX. Do you have that installed on your system?


Thanks Zack.

That was it. I downloaded the AJAX stuff and everything and that changed things.

Tony

z2bass wrote:
Finally... some good news! :-)


Zack.

I have to apologize. You previously asked me if i changed any of the source code and said no. Well, it turns out that i forgot about the steps i followed to upload this web site to GoDaddy.com. Since then i went to discountAsp.net and never had any problems uploading my website.

The document with the steps i followed from here: http://forums.asp.net/p/970186/1220730.aspx#1220730, showed at step 16 to change all occurences of "dbo." to blank in the source code. I'm sure that has something to do with the databases. I followed those instructions because i thought i was going to use GoDaddy as my hoster.

Later, when i went to discountAsp.net as a hoster, i forgot about those changes and i'm sorry for misinforming you.

I have put all of the "dbo."'s back, uploaded a clean version of the data, reattached it and things seem to be working as they should.

Thanks for all of your help.

Tony
I am VERY glad to hear that it all worked out!
